88.title: Like a River
88.author: Pierre Wazem ; translator, Sasha Watson.
notes: (Metal Hurlant Presents ; no. 1)

"With a loaded shotgun barrel in his mouth, a widowed old man is ready to pull the trigger just as he is abruptly interruped by an unexpected visit from his long forgotten son. What ensues is a poetic, emotionally raw tale of familial bond. A powerful example of comics' capability, by the influential Swiss author Pierre Wazem."
Translation of: Comme une Rivière.

130.appears_in: p. 63 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: The General is convinced the men like and respect him because they all smiled when they passed in review.

131.heading: Liking.
131.title: "Hopeless Cheez Doodle Romantic"
131.author: Lincoln Peirce.
notes: Summary: They like each other, it's official, and Nate slips an item onto Angie's finger.
Key words: Rings, reciprocation.

132.heading: Liking.
132.title: "I Think He Likes You"
132.author: Stephan Pastis.
notes: Summary: Stromoski the undateable frog, licks the pig in the bubble.

133.heading: Liking.
133.title: "She Does Not Like You, Mr. Duck"
133.author: by Bobby London (San Francisco, Calif
133.series: Dirty Duck) 1 p. in The Dirty Duck Book

134.heading: Liking Boys.
134.title: "She Likes Him"
134.author: Lincoln Peirce.
notes: Summary: Angie answers in person, and Nate had been optimistic, but just in case used washable markers to draw all the hearts on the wall.

135.heading: Liking Clothes.
135.title: "Aesthetics"
135.author: Young and LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood waits to find out if the dress is on sale before he says whether he likes it.
Key word: Salesladies.

136.heading: Liking Food.
136.title: "Guess He Doesn't Like This Brand of Cat Food"
136.author: by Gilbert Shelton ; and 1/2 p
136.series: Fat Freddy's Cat ; 164) 1 p. in The Adventures of Fat Freddy's Cat, no. 4
136.appears_in: in The Adventures of Fat Freddy's Cat, no. 4 (1988)

137.heading: Liking Food.
137.title: "I Guess We Were Both Right"
137.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: At the diner, the owner and the cook argue about whether Dagwood will like something, and upon trying it, Dagwood smiles, then runs.

138.heading: Liking Food.
138.title: "Joey Liked It Until I Told Him It Was Pee Soup"
138.author: Hank Ketcham.

139.heading: Liking Girls.
139.title: "When I Grow Old Enough to Start Liking Girls, I Think I'll Start with Matilda"
139.author: Bil Keane.

140.title: "Likriss Sikniss" 1 p. in The Black Comic Book
140.author: by Sid Jacobson & Ernie Colon (Los Angeles : Price/Stern/Sloan, 1970).
notes: Parody of Dennis the Menace, with black characters.

notes:
